cves.description: An OS command injection vulnerability in lib/NSSDropoff.php in ZendTo 5.24-3 through 6.x before 6.10-7 allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the tmp_name parameter when dropping off a file via a POST /dropoff request.
problemType: CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

cves.description: A type confusion vulnerability in lib/NSSAuthenticator.php in ZendTo before v5.04-7 allows remote attackers to bypass authentication for users with passwords stored as MD5 hashes that can be interpreted as numbers. A solution requires moving from MD5 to bcrypt.
problemType: CWE-843 Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')
